snippet: Carlyle had spent an unsettled and mainly joyless summer, while Mrs. Carlyle had gone on from her cousin's, at Auchtertool  Manse, Kirkcaldy, to Haddington, saddest and dearest of places to her, unvisited now by her for twenty-three years; indeed, ever since her marriage. There was for her a solemn gladness in the midst of all the newly-awakened pain; but Carlyle was ' hag-ridden ' : a miserable few days at Auchtertool,  where he stopped to see his wife, was followed by a most uncomfortable visit to the Ashburtons in a Highland shooting- box.
